entry.title: Integration Modernization goes SAP TechEd
entry.content:
Integration Modernization goes SAP TechEd

SAP TechEd 2025 will take place from November 4‚Äì6 in Berlin and online, offering developers and IT professionals deep insights into SAP AI, the Business Data Cloud, and the Integration Suite through hands-on labs, expert sessions, and networking opportunities.

Integration Modernization will be part of the SAP TechEd event.

Several Deep Dive Sessions and Hands-On Workshops are planned in collaboration with Product Management and an international team. In addition, our experts will be available at two information booths for direct exchange and networking.

Information booths (all day):

  • Move to the cloud with SAP Integration Suite - (Accelerate your digital transformation by moving to the cloud with SAP Integration Suite and PI Migration Assessment)
  • Integrated, innovate, and modernize with SAP Integration Suite - (Get a general overview and explore use cases, demos, and best practices for SAP Integration Suite)

Deep Dive Session (approx. 45 min):

  • Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite - (Start with a deep dive into migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite by exploring tools, Edge Integration Cell, best practices, and key challenges to ensure a smooth cloud transition.)
  • Run integration scenarios in private landscapes with Edge Integration Cell - (Edge Integration Cell‚ÄîSAP Integration Suite‚Äôs next-generation hybrid runtime that lets you manage APIs and run integrations securely in your private cloud or on-premise landscape.)

Hands-On Workshops (approx. 120 min.) :

  • Central monitoring of integration scenarios with the SAP Cloud ALM solution - (Gain full visibility into your integration landscape with centralized monitoring powered by SAP Cloud ALM)
  • Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite - (Ensure reliable message sequencing by implementing exactly-once in-order delivery with SAP Integration Suite)
  • Modernize and transform your integration to the cloud - (Explore the SAP Integration Suite‚Äôs Migration Assessment and Cloud Integration tooling hands-on, including its newly introduced pipeline feature, which enhances integration efficiency and scalability.
  • Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh - (Gain hands-on experience with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh, starting with queues and topics, then explore filtering and event replay to build dynamic, event-driven scenarios.)

Join the experience: Onsite ‚Äî or can't make it to Berlin? Go Virtual !

SAP Integration Suite is redefining enterprise integration by breaking down silos and connecting diverse systems across the business. Whether you're managing an SAP-centric landscape or a hybrid IT environment, its 360-degree Suite approach offers a comprehensive toolset for end-to-end integration and drives business innovation.

We‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts and experiences with SAP Integration Suite. What challenges are you facing? How can we help you unlock the full potential of your IT ecosystem? Feel free to connect on TechEd or reach out to us via SAP Integration Services.

#Modernize #Integrate #Innovate ‚Äì SAP Integration Modernization TEAM

entry.title: Put your thinking cap on! It‚Äôs time to make some tough choices‚Ä¶
entry.content:
Ok friends, it‚Äôs the moment you‚Äôve been waiting for. The SAP TechEd agenda builder is now LIVE. Do you know what that means?! It means that you can now create your own personalized agenda for our 3-day extravaganza ‚Äì including booking the highly-coveted Hands-On Workshops in Berlin! (Trust me ‚Äì they‚Äôre a kind of a big deal!)

Remember: you need a Full Conference Pass to book Hands-On Workshops and there is a maximum of 2 allowed per attendee. Act now and book your favorites! They fill up FAST!

Building your agenda is really quite simple‚Ä¶

Just find the session you want to attend, choose Add to Schedule and that's it!

The hard part will be deciding which sessions are ‚Äúthe ones‚Äù that earn precious time during your TechEd event experience.

Let‚Äôs do a quick recap of exactly what‚Äôs available in Berlin:

Strategy Talks: 25‚Äô overview of main strategic initiatives that any SAP enthusiast needs to know. These sessions include insights from SAP leaders and often feature customers and partners who share their experiences and outlook towards innovation and transformation.

My pick: ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools

Road Maps: Any good developer knows that they need to stay up on the latest and greatest innovations in order to do their job well. Join these 25‚Äô sessions to learn what has been recently delivered by SAP and what‚Äôs planned for the next several quarters.

My pick: AI822 | Road map: What‚Äôs planned for Joule

Deep Dives: 45‚Äô lecture-style sessions designed to broaden your knowledge and give you concrete, tangible insights you can take back to your SAP development and implementation projects.

My pick: IN100 | Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite

Hands-On Workshops: ‚ÄúLearn by doing‚Äù in these guided 2-hour, exercise-based sessions where our SAP experts have created the perfect ‚Äúenvironment‚Äù for you to explore, learn and enhance your skills.

My pick: AD164 | Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers

Community Talks: Tired of listening to SAP talk about SAP? Don‚Äôt worry, it happens to the best of us. üòâ Join one of the Community Talks at the Community Clubhouse and learn what your peers are up to.

My pick: CT1249 | Real-life clean core in SAP Cloud ERP Private: Keep it clean, extend smart

I know‚Ä¶that‚Äôs A LOT to choose from. That‚Äôs why I said‚Ä¶put your thinking caps on. üòâ

Not to make it even more difficult for you, but I would be doing the community a disservice if I did not mention some of our ‚Äúdrop-in activities.‚Äù

Community Clubhouse: This is not only where you‚Äôll find the Community Theater, but also the Developer Garage and Developer and Community Advocates like @RichHeilman, @thomas_jung, @josh_bentley, @qmacro  and more... Stop by the Clubhouse, join a Community Talk, try out a tutorial, chat with SAP Mentors & Champions, meet the Developer Advocates and start building connections that‚Äôll last longer than SAP brand names. üòâ

Demo Stations: Seeing is believing, which is why we have an amazing selection of demos across our 9 different tracks that will leave you with no other choice than to say ‚ÄúYes, I believe.‚Äù

If you are not joining us in Berlin, you‚Äôll still be able to build an agenda for SAP TechEd Virtual! Be sure to leave some time in your busy calendar to get the latest and greatest insights coming to you directly from Berlin. With a curated selection of Strategy Talks, Road Maps and Deep Dives, you‚Äôll be in-the-know from the comfort of your own home or office.

As a special treat, we‚Äôll have some live segments exclusively for you, our virtual audience! I won‚Äôt share any details yet‚Ä¶but if you tune into TechEd Virtual outside of the scheduled sessions, it will be worth your while, I promise.

I haven‚Äôt mentioned the keynotes, opening or closing sessions‚Ä¶ because those are no-brainers. Don‚Äôt worry about adding them to your schedule, we‚Äôve done that for you already. üòâ

Happy scheduling! See you in Berlin or online!

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Elevate your learning, certification, and community experience
entry.content:
SAP TechEd (November 4‚Äì6, 2025) is just around the corner, bringing the SAP Community together for three days of learning and exchange. As a registered attendee, you‚Äôll have the chance to access a 25% discount on SAP Certification with two exam attempts ‚Äî a great opportunity to continue building your skills and showcase your expertise. 

Beyond certification, there are even more ways to get involved early. From community celebrations to hands-on learning and exclusive attendee benefits, SAP TechEd in 2025 offers multiple paths to build skills and connect with peers. 

Here are four highlights you won‚Äôt want to miss:  

Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd: September 29 ‚Äì October 24, 2025 

Kicking things off is Devtoberfest, a multi-week, developer-focused celebration leading up to SAP TechEd. Running from September 29 to October 24, Devtoberfest is an opportunity to learn, connect, and celebrate coding with the global developer community.  

Expect tutorials, challenges, and technical sessions designed to help you sharpen your skills. Participation is flexible, and every activity you complete earns points as part of the experience. It‚Äôs an engaging way to connect with fellow developers while exploring the latest SAP technologies.  

Devtoberfest also includes a contest with a grand prize: winners from past years have joined retreats and exclusive SAP TechEd experiences, and last year‚Äôs winners will be with us in Berlin. The tradition continues in 2025, with the grand prize leading to a special retreat at a future SAP TechEd event in 2026.

Discover Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd.  

Explore the Learning Zone  

 

Why wait until November to start building new skills? The learning zone for SAP TechEd is open now, packed with resources to help you get a jumpstart on your learning journey. 

Dive in to take advantage of: 

  • Over 40+ interactive value journeys and solution showcases.  
  • More than 30+ free, self-paced learning journeys aligned to SAP TechEd content tracks.  
  • Dozens of demos and real-world use cases offering hands-on experience.  

Whether you‚Äôre looking to prepare for certification, deepen your knowledge, or explore new technologies, the learning zone provides a head start.  

Explore the learning zone today to get started on your SAP TechEd journey.  

Certification Benefits for Attendees  

SAP TechEd in 2025 also brings valuable opportunities to earn your SAP Certification.  

  • Exclusive 25% Discount: All registered attendees, whether joining virtually or onsite, will receive a 25% discount on SAP Certification. This discount applies to the two exam attempts booking and supports all participants on their path towards success. 
  • Free SAP Certification at SAP TechEd in Berlin: On the final event day, in-person attendees have the chance to take a free certification exam on site.

Learn more and register now. 

These benefits make it easier than ever to validate your skills and showcase your expertise. 

Get Ready for SAP TechEd in 2025  

By joining Devtoberfest, exploring the learning zone, and taking advantage of certification offers, you can make the most of your SAP TechEd experience before the event even begins. 

This year, SAP TechEd 2025 is back as a hybrid experience‚Äîjoin us in Berlin or connect online for learning and networking opportunities. Register here for the experience that suits you best!

We‚Äôre also bringing SAP TechEd on Tour to three additional cities:

  • Louisville
  • Sydney
  • Bangalore

Don‚Äôt miss your chance to be part of the global SAP community‚Äîvirtually or on site‚Äîand immerse yourself in learning, collaboration, and inspiration.

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 11th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

Podcast: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/11/sap-developer-news-september-11th-2025/ 

CAP August 2025 release 

  • Release notes https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/releases/aug25  

ABAP AI - Chapter 2 

  • Blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/abap-ai-chapter-2/ba-p/14210568 

SAP Business Data Cloud Series 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud Series ‚Äì Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-business-data-cloud-series-part-3-customer-managed-data-products/ba-p/14195545 
  • SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud ‚Äì a Typical Machine Learning Workflow: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-databricks-in-sap-business-data-cloud-a-typical-machine-learning/ba-p/14206612 
  • Data and AI at Devtoberfest: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/eb-p/devtoberfest-events/label-name/data%20analytics%20ai  

Devtoberfest 2025 

  • Devtoberfest 2025: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-welcome/ba-p/14182817 

SAP TechEd Agenda Builder 

  • Ceci‚Äôs blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/put-your-thinking-cap-on-it-s-time-to-make-some-tough-choices/ba-p/14211727 
  • SAP TechEd Session Catalog and Agenda Builder: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog 
  • SAP TechEd Berlin: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin.html 
  • SAP TechEd Virtual: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/virtual.html 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro
0:10 CAP Aug 2025 Release
6:04 ABAP AI - Chapter 2
7:25 SAP Business Data Cloud Series
8:40 SAP TechEd Agenda Builder
9:55 Devtoberfest 2025

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 11th, 2025.

[DJ] In case you missed it, the August 2025 release of CAP has landed with myriad updates. Now, this is going to be a slightly longer news item than usual, so grab a cup of tea and settle in. So, front and center for us all is the brand new cap‚âΩire organization on GitHub, which contains a reorganized set of repos, including individual sample repos, plus the cap‚âΩire documentation source repo itself, where contributions are welcome. Along with this reorganization comes continuous content deployments and a setup of package publication, which is great, not least for package reuse. And this cap‚âΩire organization is also the new home for discussions all around Cap. Check it out. So now in the new and recently GA, generally available topic, we can see that the previously beta-only support for persistent Fiori draft messages has now graduated and become GA. Also, there's a new MCP server for Cap that can provide AI-powered development help. Talking of GA in the language and compiler topic you may remember the introduction of support for expressions as first class annotation values well that support is also now GA. Staying in the language and compiler topic the query compiler has a new optimization for path expressions involving managed to one associations. A foreign key path expression is now translated to the local foreign key column instead of the joined remote one in the Node.js runtime this is now default and you can turn it on with a switch in the Java runtime. Now in a related update you can now collapse foreign key path expressions for managed to one associations into something simpler and let auto-coercion resolve this view into the more specific single foreign key specification like this example shown in a where clause. Now moving to the Node.js and Java runtimes there are plenty of updates too. Let's start with Node.js. There's a feature that was first introduced in the Java runtime back in April this year. This has also now been made available in Node.js. It's how elements that are annotated with common.txt are automatically included when a dollar search request is processed. Great stuff. There's also now a new database service level feature that allows you to stream query results direct from the persistence layer to the HTTP response, bypassing any need to materialize the result set in memory. There are also new features relating to requiring and connecting to remote services, a new utility method for working with linked definitions, and a new container for authentication-related information. And that's cdsuser.authinfo. This replaces the now deprecated cdsuser.tokeninfo. Moving to the Java runtime, there are quality of life, quality of dev life improvements when working with query results. For typed queries the results are automatically typed and you don't need to provide the access interface anymore if you're using the single list of or stream of methods. Now for single tenant applications, this is staying in a Java runtime right now, the feature attachment plugin now supports in an alpha version the SAP BTP object store and now you'll need a service binding to an object store backend. AWS's S3, Azure's blob storage, and Google's cloud storage are all supported. Now you may already know of CDS generate, part of the CDS Maven plugin, which automatically generates access interfaces for all structured CDS model types. This feature has been evolving and the team recommends you do use this as it brings benefits and in turn allows better compile time checking. Now, there's lots of detailed documentation on this, just waiting for your reading pleasure in cap‚âΩire, so go and check it out. Last but not least, there's now a convenience URL that you can directly select from the console log output, and it'll take you directly to the server's index page. Nice. Moving on to the tools area, the CDS plugin for IntelliJ is now at 2.0.0, and is now fully compatible with the free community edition of IntelliJ, which means that anyone and everyone can use IntelliJ for CAP development. The new 2.0.0 version brings lots of IDE features, lots of new features for the IDE, enhanced LSP integration and new options in the settings page. And there are also in the tools topic, new ESLint checks for JavaScript, making your life as a developer easier and the life of your code smoother. There are five safety checks so far, take a look in the cds lint section of cap hire. And last but certainly not least in this release there's been some awesome work in the area of GitHub actions, a new guide, sample workflows and lots more to help you manage test, deploy, package and release your CAP projects. Now that is cool. All this and more in the August 2025 release section of the CapHire documentation. Thanks, CapTeam.

 [Mamikee] Big news for ABAP developers. ABAP AI just keeps growing. Back in February, we announced that Joule speaks ABAP. Since then, there has been a wave of new AI-driven skills. Now, you can generate wrap business objects from the database table all the way to the UI service. You can create unit tests, explain code, complete code directly in the editor, and even implement validation and determination. These capabilities are already live in the SAP VTP ABAP environment and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. And they're coming to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition in the 2025 release. Even better, ABAP AI remains free of charge. The free promotions we introduced earlier this year have been extended until further notice. And here is another big step forward. ABAP AI will also become available for older S/4HANA private releases. Think of an AI service running side-by-side with their ABAP instance. That means you can benefit from the latest innovations without waiting for an upgrade. Want the full details? You can stay tuned for TechEd 2025. And if you want to read more on these release updates, the link is in the description below.

[Witalij] SAP Business Data Cloud, BDC, brings a data product-centric approach to managing business data. Each data product is a curated, semantically enriched package of business process data, harmonized and replicated from systems like SAP S/4HANA. For solution developers and architects among here, BDC offers a standardized platform to build, extend, and consume these data products, exposing them through APIs or events for integration with both SAP and third-party applications. To dive deeper, check out the SAP Business Data Cloud blog series, including the latest post on customer-managed data products. You'll see how to build a custom data product in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using a custom CDS entity. There is also a dedicated series that walks through consuming data products in SAP Databricks for machine learning workflows and exposing them for inference. You'll find links to all these resources in the description. And as the Devtoberfest approaches, be sure to catch the sessions featuring product managers and the CTO of SAP Business Data Cloud.

[Daniel] SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin has just released the Agenda Builder, so you can now set your schedule for the event. Just scroll through all of the sessions, 250 keynotes, hands-on workshops, community talks, strategy talks, roadmaps and more. Select the ones that you like, click add to schedule and you're set to go. They are added to your dashboard. What's really great is that the sessions you would dream of missing are already in your schedule, like Key101, the Developer Keynote, run by a bunch of developer advocates you may recognize. If you're in Berlin, please drop by and say hello. If you can't make it to Berlin, you can still create an agenda for SAP TechEd Virtual, and the same Key101 Developer Keynote will be automatically added to your schedule. I love playing with the theme.

[Michelle]  Howdy y'all, everyone's favorite fall tech fest is just about to start. Devtoberfest 2025 kicks off on September 29th, which is only a few weeks away. Each day spotlights a different theme: ABAP, frontend tooling, AI, and more. As in years past, it's free and fully online, so jump in, earn points on the scoreboard, chase nirvana and put yourself in the running for the grand prize, which this year is a retreat to a future TechEd event and meet us developer advocates in person. Check out the post linked below for more info on the great sessions we've got coming up and the contest to see how you can win that fantastic grand prize. We hope you're just as excited to participate as we are to go live, and as always, happy coding!

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Check out the Cloud ERP Track!
entry.content:
SAP TechEd goes Hybrid

Join us in person at SAP TechEd Berlin on November 4-6, 2025 or online at SAP TechEd Virtual on November 4-6, 2025 to connect with SAP experts, broaden your technical expertise and to explore the latest innovations in application development.‚ÄØ 

 

  What is in for me in the Cloud ERP Track?

In the ‚ÄØtrack ‚ÄúDigital Transformation with Cloud ERP‚Äù you will explore how‚ÄØ Cloud ERP supports your digital transformation with solutions for your needs. Whether you‚Äôre adopting your first ERP or migrating from an existing one, learn how cloud ERP offers a comprehensive, modular, and extensible solution driven by built-in AI and analytics. 

This track covers a broad range of topics, including transitioning paths to SAP Business Suite with tools, services, and methodologies, extensibility both on-stack and side-by-side on SAP Business Technology Platform, clean core, architecture, AI, and many more.  

Our experts will not only talk about the latest innovations but will also showcase various demos and share best practices with you. You will also have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience.  

 

  Track stars (top sessions to keep on your radar) 

Start jour journey to Cloud ERP:

  • DT102 | Choosing the right path to SAP Business Suite for your business | or virtual DT102v 
  • DT161 | Implementation experience for SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT262 | Implementation accelerators for SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT103 | Guidance to ease your transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private | or virtual DT103v 
  • DT264 | How to start transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private 

Extend and continuously innovate with Cloud ERP: 

  • DT200 | Unravel the mysteries of clean core extensions in SAP Cloud ERP Private 
  • DT260 | Modernize classic extensions for clean core in SAP Cloud ERP Private 
  • DT201 | Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT261 | Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP 

 

 Get more insights!

Want to learn more about the track Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP? Explore the‚ÄØSAP TechEd 2025 Berlin and SAP TechEd 2025 Virtual session catalogs‚ÄØand ensure your favourite track sessions are on your list.‚ÄØ


Save the date and register today!  November 4-6, 2025 SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual

entry.title: SAP TechEd on Tour is Coming to Sydney!
entry.content:
Big news! SAP TechEd on Tour is landing in Sydney this November as part of Mastering SAP Collaborate From 12‚Äì14 November 2025, the ICC Sydney will become the ultimate hub for learning, innovation, and connecting with the SAP community.

 

 

 

 

 

Why You Can‚Äôt Miss This

This isn‚Äôt just another conference. This is where experts meet learners, tech meets business and where the #SAPCommunity comes alive.

Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs waiting for you:

  • Tracks covering everything from AI & Joule to Data & Analytics, S/4HANA Core, Security & Risk, Finance, Integration, HCM, and more.
  • Practical, hands-on learning you can use to solve business challenges
  • Networking with peers, partners, and SAP leaders who share your challenges (and solutions!)

Developers, This One‚Äôs for You

Our SAP Developer Advocates are joining us in Sydney - bringing fresh insights, live demos, and their best tips.

Don‚Äôt miss the Developer Garage. Your playground to:

  • Get hands-on with SAP BTP, AI, and App Dev
  • Learn new topics at your own pace
  • Experiment with guidance from SAP experts right beside you

This year is packed with possibilities! You can dive into building AI agents with Joule, unlock real-time insights with SAP Business Data Cloud, accelerate full-stack app development with GenAI, and modernize your integration landscape with SAP Integration Suite.

And that‚Äôs not all. SAP Mentors and SAP Champions will also be in the house, sharing their expertise, experiences, and community spirit. A perfect chance to connect with the people who inspire and guide the global SAP ecosystem.

Get the knowledge & then get certified with a 25% savings

Another great reason to be part of this event, is the 25% discount on any SAP Certification exam. Come and explore the most up-to-date official SAP TechEd knowledge and knowhow, and then put it to good use as part of your certification prep. The 25% saving offer is valid to 19 December. More details can be found here.

Be Part of It

If you are in the SAP ecosystem, this is the event. Whether you are a developer, architect, consultant, or business leader - there‚Äôs something here for you.

üìÖ 12‚Äì14 November 2025
üìç ICC Sydney Exhibition Centre

View the agenda here.

Register here.

entry.title: Shape What‚Äôs Next with SAP Integration Suite at TechEd 2025

entry.title: My expert playlist, SAP TechEd, Virtual
entry.content:
Hi Community!

This year‚Äôs SAP TechEd Virtual is a great opportunity to explore the latest in application development. Since my main interests are SAP Fiori, CAP, and RAP, I‚Äôve put together my expert playlist of sessions to watch.

KEY100v | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next

Sessions

entry.title: A day in the life of a cloud ERP implementation consultant at SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
As a cloud ERP implementation consultant, I‚Äôm always looking for ways to sharpen my skills, stay on top of innovations, and connect with peers who face the same challenges in customer projects. For me, SAP TechEd has always been the place where all of this comes together and I‚Äôm sure TechEd 2025 in Berlin will be no different.

It‚Äôs not just about listening to sessions. It‚Äôs about walking away with concrete knowledge and hands-on experience I can apply on Monday morning with my customers. Here‚Äôs how I‚Äôve built my personal agenda for TechEd 2025.

Hopefully, it gives you some inspiration for planning your own.

 

Day 1 - Getting started with the big picture

My first day is about getting inspired, hearing the strategy, and understanding the direction of SAP‚Äôs Business Suite and cloud ERP.

  • 9:30 AM - 9:55 AM CET:
    ST108 | Stop managing complexity: Start building what really matters
  • 10:30 AM - 11:15 AM CET:
    DT102 | Choosing the right path to SAP Business Suite for your business
  • 12:30 PM - 12:55 PM CET:  
    PAR101 | Accelerate your IT transformation with process-aware agentic testing
  • 12:30 PM - 2:30 PM CET:
    DT161 | Implementation experience for SAP Cloud ERP

Day 2 - Deep Dive into daily bread and butter

Day 2 is where I get into the practical details that matter most for my projects.

  • 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET:
    DT262 | Implementation accelerators for SAP Cloud ERP
    I need to speed up here to make it to my next favorited session. üòâ
  • 12:15 PM - 1:00 PM CET:
    DT100 | From onboarding to go-live with SAP Cloud ERP
  • 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM CET:
    DT264 | How to start transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private
  • 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET:
    DT103 | Guidance to ease your transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private

Day 3 - Looking ahead and staying competitive

The final day is all about exploring future trends and preparing for what‚Äôs next.

  • 9:00 AM - 9:45 AM CET:
    BTM105 | Shaping the future with integrated IT and business process management
  • 10:30 AM - 10:55 AM CET:
    DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP with SAP and Accenture
  • 12:00 PM - 12:45 PM CET:
    AI105 | Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio
  • In the afternoon, I also plan to spend time at the demo pod.
    A great chance to discuss my long list of topics with experts and get practical advice for customer projects:
    DT917 | Cloud ERP implementation and transition paths

Final thoughts

As an implementation consultant, I know the daily reality: deadlines, requirements, and the pressure to deliver. SAP TechEd 2025 helps me reset, recharge, and return with new knowledge that directly impacts my work.

If you‚Äôre an implementation consultant like me, TechEd isn‚Äôt just another event. It‚Äôs where our role gets the spotlight and where we walk away better equipped to help customers succeed.

entry.title: Call for Community Talk Speakers! Step into the Spotlight at SAP TechEd on Tour ‚Äì Bangalore 2025
entry.content:
Hello SAP community enthusiasts! 

 Are you passionate about sharing your knowledge and experiences with fellow tech-savvy individuals attending SAP TechEd on Tour? Do you have innovative ideas or insights into SAP technologies that you think could benefit others? If so, here's an exciting opportunity for you to shine!  

We are offering Community Talks, which are 20-minutes session slots, to be filled by community members to share their knowledge with the community onsite at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore. Sign up as Community Talk speaker for our much-anticipated event taking place on November 25-26, 2025! 

As a Community Talk Speaker you‚Äôll get a ‚ÄúLecture-Only‚Äù ticket to attend SAP TechEd. Travel and Expenses are not covered by SAP.

Why Participate as a Community Talk Speaker? 

As a speaker at SAP TechEd, you'll be at the forefront of inspiring and engaging with technical professionals, developers, and business leaders. It's a unique opportunity to: 

  • Showcase Your Expertise: Share your unique insights, experiences, and innovations with a diverse audience. Hands-on, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  • Network and Collaborate: Connect with other SAP professionals, enthusiasts, and thought leaders from around the globe in the Community Theatre at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore. 
  • Expand Your Reach: Gain visibility in the SAP ecosystem and establish yourself as a go-to expert in your field. 

Topics to Consider 

We're looking for presentations on a wide range of topics that resonate with SAP TechEd's core focus areas. There are nine content tracks, please have a look at all of them on the SAP TechEd Event Website. These include (but are not limited to): 

  • Application Development and Automation 
  • Business Transformation Management 
  • AI and machine learning applications in SAP such as Business AI and Joule 
  • Breakthroughs in data management and analytics 
  • Integration 
  • Cloud Applications  

If you have a creative idea that pushes the boundaries of what's possible with SAP, we'd love to hear about it! 

Important Dates and Deadlines: 

To ensure you don't miss out, please keep an eye on the following important dates: 

  • Deadline for Speaker Applications and your Session Submissions: October 10, 2025 
  • Notification of Acceptance: October 17, 2025 
  • Final Presentation Submission for review: November 10, 2025 (if you don‚Äôt intend to have a presentation for your session, even better!) 
  • Date of the event: November 25-26, 2025 (ensure to be available on both days until the Community Talks schedule is finalized) 

How to Apply 

Think you're ready to take the stage? Here‚Äôs how you can apply: 

  1. Prepare Your Proposal: Outline the main points and objectives of your talk. Make sure it aligns with this year‚Äôs focus areas (see SAP TechEd Event Website for content tracks) and is tech-content (it should not be marketing products, services or companies).  Again, hands-on-style, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  2. Submit Your Application: Write an email to us and complete the email with all session details. Use this mailto link as it is prepared with all details for your convenience.  
  3. Document Your Passion: Highlight your enthusiasm and experience with SAP solutions‚Äîinclude any previous speaking engagements or relevant achievements. You‚Äôre very welcome to share an abstract of your session here in community.sap.com and gain feedback and reputation as a fellow community member.  

Join us in Bangalore! 

Let's make this year's conference inspirational and groundbreaking together. We can‚Äôt wait to hear your stories, ideas, and innovations. Join us and become an integral part of the SAP Community! 

Feel free to share this opportunity with your colleagues and networks who may be interested in speaking or attending. Together, let‚Äôs continue to push the boundaries of technology and innovation. 

We look forward to seeing you at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore!

entry.title: The Pragmatist‚Äôs Guide to AI: From Architectural Foundation to Real-World Value
entry.content:
Picture this: a demand forecast model trained on years of sales data looks perfect in testing, but once live, it misses a major promotion and a supply chain disruption because that data sits elsewhere. The model wasn‚Äôt wrong ‚Äî it was perfectly wrong.

At SAP TechEd 2025, a joint session with Google Cloud will show how to close the Context Gap and unlock real business impact with AI. The session will explore:

  • The provocation ‚Äì Casey West, Lead Developer Advocate at Google Cloud, reframes the AI challenge, introducing the Context Gap.
  • The proof in action ‚Äì Laura Marwood, SAP Product Strategist for the SAP Business Suite will show a live demo on how SAP‚Äôs unified suite lets AI orchestrate seamlessly across roles and systems that turns chaos into growth
  • The architectural blueprint ‚Äì Manoj Swaminathan, GM and CPO of the SAP Business Suite, Finance and Spend explains the foundation: a clean core, unified data fabric on BTP, and embedded AI by design.
  • The playbook ‚Äì A practical maturity model guides teams from efficiency > productivity > true impact.

This is AI for pragmatists: closing the Context Gap with SAP‚Äôs suite-first strategy so AI doesn‚Äôt just generate output - it creates lasting business value.

üëâ Don‚Äôt miss this session at SAP TechEd 2025!

https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog/session/1749125306565001Gf8a

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025 - Go Mobile!!!
entry.content:
SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on November 4th in Berlin, and preparations are in full swing! This premier tech conference is perfect for developers, IT professionals, business experts, and tech visionaries to deepen their knowledge of SAP solutions and connect with peers and SAP experts. 

We have prepared an exciting offering of mobile sessions for you: Strategic Talks, Roadmap and Hands-on sessions on Mobile Apps, Mobile Design and Mobile Technology. Furthermore, we will have a demo booth where you can explore our apps an Mobile Joule on your own. 

Certainly Mobile AI, is the focus topics this year. 

Here are some of the sessions I‚Äôm most looking forward to this year:

CA200 | An overview of our AI-enhanced mobile products across SAP Business Suite - Deep Dive
View demos of selected apps and learn how the latest mobile apps from SAP make it easier for your users to leverage SAP Business Suite on the go. You can build your own mobile apps the same way we do‚Äîstart by exploring how we use SAP Design System for mobile apps as well as the latest technologies such as the Joule copilot and SAP Build solutions.  

ST112 | AI and the future of product and user experience on the web and mobile - Strategy Talk
Discover how the Joule copilot and embedded AI are transforming UX as well as how you can use AI to enhance and extend the UX for SAP Business Suite. See our strategy for giving users access to all they need and enabling them to provide feedback, wherever they are, through the web and on mobile, including applications and central services.

CA811 | User and product experience innovations by SAP‚Äîon the web and mobile - Road Map
Have a look at the latest user and product experience innovations across our suite of applications, along with cool innovations coming soon‚Äîon the web and mobile. Also, check out selected highlights from UI technologies.

AD170 | Build scalable enterprise mobile solutions with SAP Build - Hands-on Workshop
Dive into the technical details of building scalable, cross-platform mobile solutions with SAP. Get a hands-on overview of integrating SAP Build solutions and our mobile development kit to streamline your development process and deliver high-quality apps.

CA260 | Learn how to build your own app and use it in SAP Mobile Start - Hands-on Workshop
Build an application on SAP BTP using SAP Build Code and SAP Cloud Application Programming Model that integrates with SAP Mobile Start. Accelerate development with development productivity tools in SAP Business Application Studio. Learn how to make the app accessible and send push notifications for relevant business events directly to your users.

CA201 | Creating AI-enhanced UX for your own applications with SAP Design System - Deep Dive
Discover how AI is changing the idea of what an application is‚Äîand what this means for you. Learn about how to create AI-enhanced UX for your applications by using SAP Design System (SAP Fiori UX for web and mobile), and see how building applications is made easier through our AI UI technologies for web and mobile apps.

AD109 | Bridging the gap: Build your enterprise mobile strategy - Deep Dive
Are your employees struggling to find critical company data on the go? The SAP Mobile Start app solves that challenge by connecting them to SAP Build Work Zone and enabling custom mobile solutions. Find out how to create a powerful, integrated mobile journey for increased productivity.

AI166 | Mobile projects with SAP Joule for Consultants and SAP Joule for Developers - Hands-on Workshop
Learn how SAP Joule for Consultants accelerates execution of mobile projects and cloud transformation by simplifying knowledge access and offering expert guidance. Also, explore SAP Joule for Developers and its mobile development kit AI capabilities‚Äîincluding code suggestions, explanations, test generation, and more‚Äîto boost development efficiency.

CA914 | AI-based user and product experience innovations on the web and mobile - Demo Station
Experience the latest user and product experience innovations by SAP, including the Joule copilot on mobile devices and AI-embedded scenarios. Learn how you can leverage SAP Design System and our UI technologies to build your own apps. 

Do not miss this opportunity and join us in Berlin. Register now! üìÖNovember 4 - 6, 2025 Berlin 
We look forward to meeting and interacting with you!

entry.title: Join SAPUI5 Sessions at SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Dear UI5 enthusiasts,

SAP TechEd 2025 is where UI5 developers meet to enhance their knowledge and get hands-on experience. This is the type of content you like to see: Understand the strategy, see highlights and try out latest capabilities around SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements.

SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on the 4th of November 2025, and preparations are in full swing in SAP. As you probably know, SAP TechEd is the leading tech conference for all developers, IT professionals, business experts, eager to gain in-depth knowledge of SAP‚Äôs technologies. It also offers an excellent opportunity to network and connect with peers and SAP experts.

 

SAP TechEd 2025: Registration is live ‚Äì check out our brand new hybrid experience!

Access the full SAP TechEd 2025 session catalogs:  SAP TechEd Berlin and SAP TechEd Virtual and see my shortlist here:

Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Some experts argue there‚Äôs a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let‚Äôs get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever.

Strategy Talks

ST117 | SAP‚Äôs user experience strategy with SAP Build
An intuitive user experience is essential for every business user. Examine SAP‚Äôs strategy for evolving SAP Build Work Zone to empower a streamlined digital workplace, and for building efficient SAP Fiori apps with SAPUI5. Hear how SAP is advancing with Joule, our AI copilot, now embedded across SAP Build solutions.

ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools - also available virtually as ST116v
Explore the most recent innovations in SAP Build solutions that help developers to create extensions, applications, and automations. Learn how enhancements in the development environment, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, and Joule copilot empower customers and partners to build extensions efficiently at scale.

Deep Dives

AD106 | The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build - also available virtually as AD106v
Discover what‚Äôs new in SAPUI5 development with SAP Build solutions. Learn to build modern SAP Fiori apps across ABAP and the cloud using new developer tools, Joule technology integration, and proven SAPUI5 capabilities. Get insights into SAP‚Äôs UI strategy with SAP Web Components and see how you can benefit. Elevate your UI with SAPUI5 in SAP Build.

AD203 | Fact-checking UI extensibility on cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you
SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps in a clean core approach. Key users use drag-and-drop tools while developers add custom code with visual editors and the Joule copilot. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and ABAP RESTful application programming model help extend data models and add custom logic in SAP Build solutions.

AD100 | Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build
The Joule for developers add-on combines all the AI capabilities in SAP Build solutions. Learn about AI-driven development and how developer productivity can be increased. Developers can use our productivity tools to make their lives easier when engaging in SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and UI development.

CA105 | Intelligent app development at scale with AI and SAP Fiori elements

With exciting updates to building blocks, a streamlined entry page, and powerful generative AI in SAP Fiori tools, developers can build applications faster than ever. Get a first look at how we integrate MCP to orchestrate AI capabilities across SAP Fiori tools and SAP Fiori elements for faster app development.

AD201 | Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build: What's in it for ABAP developers

Understand the importance of our strategic approach of integrating ABAP Cloud into SAP Build solutions. Find out how you can benefit from this for SAP Fiori app development and how the graphical modeler helps you to create ABAP core data services models conveniently. Finally, get insight into our future direction.

Roadmap Sessions

AD818 | Explore the road map for user experience with SAP Build
SAP Build solutions feature many new and upcoming user experience capabilities. Find out how SAP Build Work Zone delivers a connected, intuitive digital workplace, including the SAP Mobile Start app. Understand SAP's road map for building SAP Fiori apps with SAPUI5. See how the Joule copilot supports user and developer productivity.

AD820 | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions - also available virtually as AD820v
Check out upcoming enhancements to SAP Build solutions involving SAP‚Äôs professional developer tools, the Joule copilot, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, SAPUI5, and SAP Fiori apps. These updates boost developer productivity, support clean core, and improve extensibility for line-of-business (LoB) apps, advancing enterprise app development.

Hands-on Workshops

AD166 | Taking UI to the next level: Develop SAPUI5 with SAP Build
Use SAP Build solutions to develop a modern app with SAPUI5. Explore latest best practices, including the UI5 linter and TypeScript to build a future-proof app. Get to know SAP Web Components and leverage them in your SAPUI5 app. Gain hands-on experience, ask questions, and see how Joule technology supports you with AI-based SAPUI5 magic.

AD260 | UI extensibility on top of cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you
SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps with a clean core approach. Key users and developers can add custom code with visual editors and Joule technology. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and the ABAP RESTful application programming model support extending data models and adding custom logic in the SAP Build solution.

AD160 | Get hands-on with Joule: Boost your SAP Build development with AI
The Joule for developers add-on brings AI capabilities directly into SAP Build solutions to support your development process. Get hands-on experience using AI-driven tools to boost your productivity in SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and UI development, with features designed to simplify your workflow and help you build faster and smarter.

CA261 | Create great UX with AI, SAP Design System, SAP Fiori elements, and SAPUI5

Learn how to create new SAP applications with great UX and AI using the reusable components, patterns, and floor plans in SAP Design System. Design with the SAP Fiori for Web UI kit from Figma, harness AI and the MCP protocol for automated app generation and real-time adaptation of SAP Fiori elements, and extend freestyle in SAPUI5.

AD163 | Fusion development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build

Practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build solutions by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the lobby for SAP Build to develop an ABAP RESTful application programming model business object, including an SAP Fiori app on top.

It sounds awesome, right? I KNOW!
See you there...

entry.title: Secure Your Digital Journey with SAP CIAM
entry.content:
Secure Your Digital Journey with SAP CIAM 

Over the years, working in customer experience and digital technologies, I have witnessed the rapid evolution of both customers and the infrastructure needed to serve them.  When you consider the ‚Äúcustomer,‚Äù the need to understand who they are has become a central focus of the user experience. The world of digital identity has continuously adapted. Social logins once felt like the future‚Äînow, passwordless or passkey authentication is a requirement. Data privacy has shifted from an afterthought to a boardroom priority, largely driven by regulations like GDPR, CCPA, and others. What used to be considered "good enough" security no longer suffices, as becoming the subject of a data breach headline is a risk no company can afford.. 

Even my daughter now warns me not to share her identity online, as I don‚Äôt have her consent‚Äîproof that awareness of digital risks is becoming second nature to the next generation. In this new era, trust isn't a nice-to-have; it‚Äôs the foundation of every customer interaction. 

That‚Äôs why Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) is a critical part of any modern digital strategy and future-forward IT landscape. When organizations get digital identity right, they unlock more than just security‚Äîthey create better, more trusted customer experiences at every touchpoint. 

 

Bridge the Gap Between Experience and Trust 

In today's digital-first landscape, businesses must navigate the challenge of delivering seamless customer experiences while ensuring robust data protection‚Äîa balance that is crucial for building trust with increasingly privacy-conscious consumers. However, many organizations are stuck navigating data silos, which fragment customer insights and prevent a unified understanding of their audience.  

SAP CIAM offers a comprehensive solution to these challenges by unifying data management, enhancing security frameworks, and simplifying privacy compliance. It empowers businesses to protect against threats, manage identities efficiently, and offer personalized user experiences that foster customer loyalty. 

SAP CIAM overcomes the limitations of outdated systems and enables organizations to confidently: 

  1. Secure users 
  1. Reduce privacy concerns 
  1. Scale efficiently 

 

  1. Secure Users and Safeguard Data  

Concerned about data breaches? SAP CIAM is engineered to protect your customer data and minimize security risks, building trust between you and your customers. By prioritizing robust threat detection and protection, this solution ensures your business remains secure, fostering loyalty and reinforcing customer confidence in sharing their data.   

  • Access real-time password suggestions 
  • Utilize built-in screen sets for password updates 
  • Generate one-time passwords 
  • Integrate with external identity services 
  • Enable biometric sign-in for secure login 
  • Harness AI risk-based authentication 

 

For a deeper look at how SAP CIAM addresses today‚Äôs evolving security landscape, join us at SAP TechEd on November 6 for a dedicated CIAM security session. Register here to secure your spot and learn more. 

 

  1. Reduce Privacy Compliance Risk 

Keeping up with evolving privacy regulations can be daunting. SAP CIAM simplifies these challenges through efficient consent management capabilities, enabling businesses to adhere to global standards like ISO, BSI, and SOC 2. With user-friendly self-service portals, SAP CIAM respects customer privacy while maintaining compliance‚Äîultimately strengthening trusting relationships. 

  • Capture consent across all channels 
  • Customize for privacy policies and brand 
  • Configure single sign-on (SSO) 
  • Enable global access 

 

  1. Increase Efficiency at Scale 

Worried about system overload during peak times? SAP CIAM effortlessly manages traffic spikes, supporting billions of unique identities and transactions monthly. This capability allows businesses to capitalize on each opportunity without technical setbacks or undue stress on IT teams. With 347 million active users across 85 thousand sites, SAP CIAM is a proven solution for large-scale digital operations. 

  • Design and execute identity flows 
  • Duplicate site configurations and settings 
  • Offer OOTB, OIDC-compliant login experiences 
  • Create identity screens with drag-and-drop 

 

Elevate Your Identity Strategy with SAP CIAM 

SAP CIAM empowers businesses to bolster their security measures, ensure data privacy compliance, and efficiently scale their digital operations. Additionally, it offers pre-configured connectivity with over 60 SAP products, including SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP S/4HANA, SAP Customer Experience solutions, and SAP cloud ERP solutions, enhancing integration across your enterprise. 

Incorporating SAP CIAM into your digital strategy could be the next step toward elevating your business with enhanced security, data protection, and scalability. 

 

Learn more here.

entry.title: SAP Developer News October 2nd, 2025
entry.content:

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 2nd, 2025.

[Kevin] Hey everyone, week one of Devtoberfest is almost over. If you want to check out what activities we've planned for week two, head over to the community, to the Devtoberfest group, and look out for the blog post, Devtoberfest, week two activities. See you there.

[Daniel] I'm here with Pepper, a flat coat retriever, to announce Petoberfest, where you can upload a picture of your pet, or your favorite zoo creature, or stuffed animal, or any furry friend you fancy. Just upload the picture as a comment to my blog post. In addition, use that picture as the basis for an AI-generated image of your pet. For example, hybris Pepper helping me with my Devtoberfest crosswords and wearing her favorite hat. Be creative both in the setup and the style. Petoberfest this year coincides with World Animal Day, so you can also upload a picture of yourself taking part in any animal welfare project. For example, renovating a straight cat hotel or walking to raise money for your local ASPCA. if you upload a picture you will win oodles of points for the devtoberfest grand prize so i'm looking forward to seeing a picture of your pet good news for all you cat fans the rest of the session

[DJ] recordings from recap 2025 are now online on youtube for your queuing and viewing pleasure now we already had the recordings of the sessions from the blue room track on the recap on conference youtube channel and now after getting hold of the recording from the audimax theater we've got the sessions from the yellow room track cut and organized into individual videos and they're in a playlist for you as well the playlist follows the agenda order. And yes, we processed everything with a little bash script and everything on the command line. The future really is terminal.

[Shrini] The scavenger hunt event runs across multiple weeks of Devtoberfest. I hope you already figured out the three clues we gave out and you have a 12-digit hexadecimal number with you. If not, you may pause this video and check out the clues we released earlier from the main blog post on the scavenger end and come back for the fourth clue. For the fourth clue we can explore some github repositories as the clue is hidden in one of the repositories. Many of you may be aware of the SAP GitHub org SAP samples. It contains sample code, TechEd tutorials, Code Jam material and hundreds of reports from which you can learn about ABAP, CAP, BUILD, and other SAP-related technology. Among the various repos, take a closer look at the SAP BTP AI Best Practices repo to find the two-character clue. This repo contains best practices, sample implementations, to build AI-powered applications and serves as a practical guide for developers looking to implement enterprise-grade AI solutions using SAP AI services and integration with generative AI models. To find the clue number four, you don't have to clone the repo. You can look around the repo, access various tabs, search within the repo for some common terms related to desktop office like build, ABAP, CAP, AI, etc. Happy hunting!

[Witalij] Before we dive in, a quick note. Our cat Felicia decided it was the perfect time for an app, so she's not joining today. But I'm here and there is plenty to share. We've just released the third SAP HANA Cloud update of 2025, packed with meaningful advancements. Here are a few highlights I've personally chosen. Vector embedding SQL functions now supports the generative AI hub, helping you integrate different models more easily. JSON is now a native data type in the document store, simplifying work with the unstructured data. Single sign-on for data lake files enhances security and accessibility. And with drill in SAP build code, you can generate SQL from natural language, making development faster and more intuitive, and you can feel like a wipe coder now. For all the details, check out the dedicated blog post or the product team's teaser video. If data modeling is your focus. Don't miss Jan Zwickal's deep-dive post on the latest in graphical view modeling. He also spoke at Devtoberfest this week. Recordings are already available, if you missed it. Finally, mark your calendar for next Thursday as well, as Christoph Morgan will explore developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications live at Devtoberfest. It's a great chance to see these features in action? Let us know what stands out to you.

[Tom] If you're in the India region, we've got an interesting opportunity for you to join the SAP TechEd On Tour in Bangalore coming up at the end of November. The community talk call for speakers is now open. If you're interested in sharing your experience or your knowledge about a particular topic in the SAP Space, this is your opportunity to get a free lecture only ticket to the SAP TechEd on Tour taking place in Bangalore. You only have until October 10th to submit your session proposal, so be sure to act quickly. We look forward to seeing you at TechEd Berlin as most of the developer advocates team will be there. We'll be cheering you on and helping mentor you for your presentation as well. So this is a great opportunity for anybody looking to get a ticket to TechEd on Tour Bangalore and to share their knowledge at the event. So look forward to seeing you there.

[Nico] Hi everyone and welcome to the developer news. Your 5-card 2025 in Bangalore is going to happen in December and the call for proposals is now open. You can submit your session proposal until October 31st. There is quickfire presentations, around 20 minutes long, in-depth sessions, 40 minutes, or longer hands-on workshops. Definitely check that out if you want to have a session at UI5Con in Bangalore. Also related to UI5, there is a new version of the SAP UI5 RoadMavic store with some interesting items on there regarding AI, obviously. There is new AI related controls and also interesting MCP items. So definitely check that one out if you are interested in SAPUI5. All right, hope to talk to you soon. Bye.

entry.title: From Penalty to Power Play: Why Identity Management Is Key to Better Customer Experiences
entry.content:
A few weeks ago, a friend bought tickets to a hockey game and wanted to transfer them to me. Like many people, we went with the quickest workaround‚Äîshe shared her login credentials so I could access the tickets. But what should have been a simple process turned into several days of password resets, missed messages, and back-and-forth. By the time I finally got into her account, the tickets were gone. She had attempted to transfer them during the delay, but amid the confusion and technical issues, I never actually received them. If I had been able to log in right away, I could have just downloaded them directly. But the access issues created confusion, and without any clear support from the platform, we ended up losing the tickets‚Äîand missing the game.

It was a simple plan that fell apart because of something as basic as account access.

This experience is a small example of a much larger issue in digital commerce: the friction that arises when identity management isn‚Äôt built with the customer in mind. It‚Äôs easy to overlook, but poor identity experiences lead directly to lost opportunities‚Äînot just for consumers, but for the businesses trying to reach them.

 

Identity Friction = Lost Revenue

In today‚Äôs commerce landscape, customer expectations are sky-high. If a login process is confusing, if an account is hard to access, or if personalization feels off‚Äîpeople walk away. And often, they don‚Äôt come back.

Poor identity experiences hurt businesses in more ways than one:

  • They interrupt the buying journey. Whether it‚Äôs a login loop, a forgotten password, or a complicated checkout flow, friction at these key points drives abandonment.
  • They block personalization. When customer data is fragmented across systems, it‚Äôs hard to deliver the tailored experiences that today‚Äôs buyers expect.
  • They erode trust. Without clear consent management and transparency, customers hesitate to share information‚Äîor stop engaging entirely.
  • They slow down growth. Outdated systems and homegrown solutions often can‚Äôt keep up with omnichannel strategies or evolving compliance needs.

For a deeper dive into how SAP CIAM can help reduce identity friction, join us at SAP TechEd on November 6 for a dedicated CIAM security session. Register here to secure your spot and learn more.

 

Where SAP CIAM + Commerce Cloud Make the Difference

Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) helps solve these challenges by making identity work for the customer‚Äînot against them. When integrated into your commerce ecosystem, CIAM doesn't just handle sign-ins‚Äîit actively supports better customer relationships and business outcomes.

Here‚Äôs how:

  • It reduces friction at every stage‚Äîfrom anonymous browsing to account creation to repeat purchases. The experience becomes smoother, simpler, and more secure.
  • It improves conversion by enabling personalized, real-time engagement without relying on clunky data handoffs or third-party cookies.
  • It builds trust by giving customers control over their data, preferences, and permissions‚Äîwhile helping businesses stay compliant across regions.
  • It supports scale by integrating identity across every digital touchpoint, enabling consistent experiences on web, mobile, in-store, and beyond.

In short, CIAM allows businesses to move away from fragmented, frustrating interactions and toward a unified customer experience that feels intuitive, safe, and relevant‚Äîevery time. To hear firsthand how SAP customers are achieving this with SAP CIAM and Commerce Cloud, join us at SAP Connect in Las Vegas on October 8. Register here to attend.

 

The Takeaway

In commerce, moments of friction are more than just annoyances‚Äîthey‚Äôre missed opportunities. Whether it‚Äôs lost hockey tickets or lost revenue, the cause is often the same: a broken identity experience.

Modern CIAM, especially when combined with a powerful commerce platform, turns identity into an asset. It streamlines the journey, protects the user, and empowers businesses to engage with clarity and confidence.

And the best part? It just works‚Äîso your customers don‚Äôt have to. 

Learn more here.
